Description: Green glazed composition fragment of an unidentified artefact, in the form of a conical shaft tapering out into a quatrefoil, pierced longitudinally.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list, if not from Tell Nabasha or any other Eastern Delta site excavated by Petrie in 1886. If from Tell Dafana, possibly the "conoid draughman" from Chamber 17, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 72, but see also London, BM, EA 18463.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.53, p.87, p.174, pl.16)
